item.title: 灾难工业综合体正在推动美国经济增长
item.description: 有些故事的开头平淡无奇，而有些故事则如闪电般袭来。只有偶尔两者兼而有之。 在今天的时事通讯中，我们将分享我们关于灾难工业综合体的新专题背后的故事，以及在飓风海伦之后，灾难工业综合体如何在北卡罗来纳州西部上演。【原文：Some stories have mundane beginnings, while others strike like lightning. Only occasionally is it both. In today’s newsletter, we share the story behind our new feature on the disaster industrial complex, and how it’s playing out in western North Carolina in the wake of Hurricane Helene.】

item.title: 大型石油公司为何要求环保局不要削减污染者报告计划
item.description:
石油和天然气行业表示，他们需要该计划的数据来开展业务。【原文：

The oil and gas industry says it needs the program’s data to conduct business. 

】

item.title: 期待咖啡价格不断创新高。这就是为什么
item.description:
最近几个月，美国对巴西征收的关税抬高了咖啡豆的价格，但从长远来看，气候变化将使咖啡豆价格居高不下。【原文：

US tariffs on Brazil have raised coffee bean prices in recent months, but climate change will keep them high over the long run. 

】

item.title: 暴风雨袭击欧洲，停电和旅行中断情况加剧
item.description: 一场造成飓风、暴雨和波涛汹涌的风暴正在侵袭欧洲，导致停电和旅行中断。【原文：A storm causing hurricane-force winds, heavy rain and choppy seas is pummeling Europe, leading to power outages and travel disruptions.】

item.title: 北约呼吁投资清洁燃料以减少对俄罗斯的依赖
item.description:
一群退伍军人和国防专家敦促欧洲领导人在布鲁塞尔峰会之前加大对绿色燃料的支持力度。【原文：

A group of military veterans and defense experts urged European leaders to boost support for green fuels ahead of their summit in Brussels.

】

item.title: 泰晤士河污染事件增加，跻身英国污染最严重的水务公司之列
item.description: 英国环境署（Environment Agency）周四称，泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）是去年英国污染最严重的水务公司之一，其严重事故总数猛增了 60%。【原文：Thames Water was among Britain’s most-polluting water companies last year as the total number of serious incidents jumped 60%, the Environment Agency said Thursday.】

item.title: 气候时代的苏联经济学启示
item.description:
艾比-因斯（Abby Innes）认为，如果我们要走上应对气候变化的正轨，世界就需要重新设想政府如何使用经济工具。【原文：

Abby Innes argues the world needs to reimagine how governments wield economic tools if we are to get on track to fight climate change.

】

item.title: 欧洲气候议程面临经济现实的考验
item.description:
欧盟领导人需要找到一种方法来减轻企业和消费者在绿色转型过程中的成本负担，同时保持对气候问题的关注。【原文：

EU leaders need to find a way to ease the cost burden of the green transition for companies and consumers while keeping climate ambition intact.

】

item.title: 中国风能专家争论 "大型化 "或 "小型化 "的利弊
item.description: 中国的可再生能源资源丰富且价格低廉，这对消费者来说是一大福音，但对生产设备的公司来说却是一种压力。领先的风力涡轮机制造商正以截然不同的解决方案应对挑战。【原文：Renewable power is plentiful and cheap in China, a boon for consumers but a strain on firms that manufacture the equipment. Leading wind turbine makers are meeting the challenge with radically different solutions.】

item.title: 连日来第二场大风暴袭击新西兰，带来混乱和电力中断
item.description: 周四，新西兰部分地区三天内第二次遭受大风袭击，飞机停飞，紧急服务部门发出警告，要求人们注意安全，避免出行。【原文：Gale-force winds battered parts of New Zealand for the second time in three days Thursday, grounding aircraft and prompting warnings from emergency services for people to take care and avoid travel.】

item.title: 美国 6 月份天气损失达到创纪录的 1010 亿美元
item.description:
根据一项新的分析，洛杉矶的火灾和春季的强风暴是主要的驱动因素。【原文：

Fires in Los Angeles and severe spring storms were the main drivers, according to a new analysis.

】

item.title: 挪威财富基金借力人工智能降低气候风险
item.description: 全球最大主权财富基金的首席执行官曾经说过，回避人工智能的员工永远不会得到晋升。现在，这家挪威基金正在利用人工智能深入了解气候变化对其所投资公司的影响。【原文：The chief executive officer at the world’s largest sovereign wealth fund once said employees shunning AI would never be promoted. Now, the Norwegian fund is using AI to get insights into how climate change is impacting the companies it invests in.】

item.title: 阿波罗称人工智能能源缺口 "在我们有生之年无法弥合
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：The amount of energy required to supply the data centers powering artificial intelligence is so vast that meeting that need may be more than a lifetime away, according to a senior executive at Apollo Global Management Inc.】

item.title: 污染者开始关注联合国甲烷警告
item.description: 越来越多的政府和公司正在对联合国发出的甲烷泄漏警报做出回应，尽管行动仍然过于有限，无法推动大幅减少这种温室气体的排放。【原文：More governments and companies are responding to United Nations-issued alerts about methane leaks, though action still remains too limited to drive major cuts to emissions of the greenhouse gas.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金利用人工智能消除气候风险
item.description: 挪威的主权财富基金是世界上最大的主权财富基金，该基金正在让人工智能在保护其 2 万亿美元的投资组合免受气候风险方面发挥关键作用。【原文：Norway’s sovereign wealth fund, the world’s biggest, is giving artificial intelligence a key role in protecting its $2 trillion portfolio from climate risk.】

item.title: 英国石油公司（BP）风能合资企业将停止美国业务，因为该行业面临反弹
item.description: 由于清洁能源面临特朗普政府的压力，英国石油公司（BP Plc）和日本 Jera Co.【原文：An offshore wind venture between BP Plc and Japan’s Jera Co. plans to close its operating activities in the US as the clean energy resource faces pressure from the Trump administration.】

item.title: 出于成本考虑，新西兰将放宽气候报告规则
item.description: 出于对企业成本的担忧，新西兰正在放宽气候报告规则，这是在旨在限制温室气体排放的政策上的又一次退缩。【原文：New Zealand is relaxing climate reporting rules on concerns over the cost to businesses, in another retreat from policies designed to limit greenhouse gas emissions.】

item.title: 英国将更容易对水务公司的污染行为处以罚款
item.description: 英国计划更容易对破坏环境的自来水公司处以罚款，从而加大对因长期污水泄漏而受到指责的公司的压力。【原文：The UK plans to make it easier to fine water companies that harm the environment, ramping up pressure on firms blamed for chronic sewage spills.】

item.title: 气候恶化，灾难工业综合体超越 S&P 500 指数
item.description: 投资者正在寻找为灾难工业综合体提供动力的公司，灾难工业综合体正在推动美国经济的发展，并超过了 S&P 500 指数。【原文：Investors are on the hunt for companies powering the disaster industrial complex, which is fueling the US economy and outpacing the S&P 500.】

item.title: GE Vernova 同意支付 53 亿美元收购 Prolec 50%的股份
item.description: 随着人工智能热潮对电力行业产品和服务需求的推动，通用电气弗诺瓦公司（GE Vernova Inc.【原文：GE Vernova Inc. has agreed to buy the stake in transformer maker Prolec GE that it doesn’t already own as the artificial intelligence boom drives demand for products and services in the power sector.】

item.title: 美国将为战略石油储备购买 100 万桶石油
item.description: 特朗普政府计划为美国战略石油储备购买 100 万桶石油，利用低油价开始填补枯竭的储备。【原文：The Trump administration plans to buy 1 million barrels for the US Strategic Petroleum Reserve, taking advantage of low oil prices to begin filling the depleted stockpile.】

item.title: 欧盟提出限制新碳市场价格的措施
item.description: 欧盟计划提出限制其新碳市场影响的措施，希望在就集团气候目标进行关键辩论之前，缓解各国政府对减排成本的担忧。【原文：The European Union plans to propose measures to limit the impact of its new carbon market, hoping to ease concerns among national governments about the cost of cutting emissions before a key debate on the bloc’s climate target.】

item.title: 法国和西班牙呼吁欧盟坚持 2035 年内燃机禁令
item.description: 本周在布鲁塞尔召开领导人会议之前，法国和西班牙与德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨（Friedrich Merz）意见相左，呼吁欧盟坚持在 2035 年后禁止集团内使用内燃机汽车的计划。【原文：France and Spain are calling on the European Union to stick with plans to ban combustion engine cars in the bloc after 2035, at odds with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz ahead of a meeting of leaders in Brussels this week.】

item.title: 日本新领导人将继续以核能为中心
item.description: 新当选的日本首相高市真奈是核电的坚定捍卫者，她誓言要将安全放在政府能源政策的核心位置。【原文：Japan’s newly-elected Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is a staunch defender of nuclear power who has vowed to put security at the heart of her government’s energy policy.】

item.title: CenterPoint 将以 26 亿美元出售俄亥俄州天然气业务
item.description: CenterPoint Energy Inc. 同意以 26 亿美元的价格将其俄亥俄州天然气公用事业出售给 National Fuel Gas Company。【原文：CenterPoint Energy Inc. agreed to sell its Ohio natural gas utility to National Fuel Gas Company for $2.6 billion.】

item.title: 斯派罗为非洲电动摩托车网络融资 1 亿美元
item.description: 在非洲六国运营电池交换网络的电动汽车公司斯皮罗获得了一轮 1 亿美元的投资，这是非洲大陆该行业获得的最大投资之一。【原文：Spiro, a electric mobility company that operates a battery-swapping network across six African nations, has clinched a $100 million investment round, one of the continent’s biggest for the industry.】

item.title: 拉加德称资本市场联盟是能源转型的关键
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲需要更深入的资本市场来应对气候变化。【原文：Europe needs deeper capital markets to stem its response to climate change, according to European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde.】

item.title: 南非获得首个跟踪天气风险的气候指数
item.description: 南非精算师推出了该国首个针对具体国家的气候指数，专家们正努力管理日益频繁的干旱、火灾、洪水和其他极端天气事件带来的风险和损失。【原文：South African actuaries launched the nation’s first country-specific climate index as experts seek to manage risks and losses brought about by an increasing frequency of droughts, fires, floods and other extreme weather events.】

item.title: 火箭技术公司有望为数据中心提供清洁能源
item.description:
Arbor能源公司由SpaceX的校友创立，其技术以天然气为燃料，并使用碳捕集技术。【原文：

Founded by SpaceX alumni, Arbor Energy’s technology runs on natural gas and uses carbon capture.

】

item.title: 巨灾债券的巨大市场收益使再保险公司陷入困境
item.description: 巨灾债券看似势不可挡的崛起现在可能正在侵蚀再保险公司的市场份额。【原文：The seemingly unstoppable rise of catastrophe bonds may now be eroding the market share of reinsurers.】
